proverb: چا ته دې اور بل کاوه، ځان ته دې ګرمۍ جوړوله
transliteration: Cha ta de or bal kawa, zaan ta de garmay jawarawala
translation: You lit a fire for others, but warmed yourself.
meaning: Good deeds done for others often benefit oneself too.

proverb: د چرګ په بانګ سهار نه کیږي
transliteration: Da chorg pa bang sahar na kege
translation: Morning doesn't come with a rooster's crow.
meaning: Talking doesn't make things happen; action does.

proverb: د چرګ په بانګ سهار نه کیږي
transliteration: Da chorg pa bang sahar na kege
translation: Morning doesn't come with a rooster's crow.
meaning: Talking doesn't make things happen; action does.

proverb: له تروږمۍ وروسته، روڼا راځي
transliteration: La tarwazmay wrusta, rona razi
translation: After darkness, comes light.
meaning: Hard times are followed by better ones.

proverb: سپي چې غاپي، چيچل نه کوي
transliteration: Spi che ghapi, chechal na kawi
translation: A barking dog seldom bites.
meaning: Those who make the most noise are often the least dangerous.

proverb: بې غمه خوب خوب دی
transliteration: Be ghma khwab khwab de
translation: A sleep without worry is real sleep.
meaning: Peace of mind is the best comfort.

proverb: پرې شوې مڼه بېرته ونه ته نه خېژي
transliteration: Pray shaway mana berta wona ta na khejhi
translation: A fallen apple doesn't climb back on the tree.
meaning: Some actions are irreversible.

proverb: هر څوک خپله پوزه د خپلې ګوتې سره پاکوي
transliteration: Har tsok khpala poza da khpalay gotay sara pakawi
translation: Everyone wipes their nose with their own finger.
meaning: People rely on themselves in hardship.

proverb: زړه ته لار شته
transliteration: Zra ta lār shta
translation: Where there is a will, there is a way.
meaning: Determination makes anything possible.

proverb: چې غر خوځيږي، نو خاوره به الوزي
transliteration: Che ghr khwazighi, no khawra ba ulozi
translation: When the mountain shakes, dust will fly.
meaning: Big actions have visible consequences.

proverb: د کلي د غره غاړه نه ده
transliteration: Da kali da ghara ghara na de
translation: The village is not the mountain's edge.
meaning: Don't judge a situation by its surface.

proverb: چې کار کاوه، هغه به خطا کاوه
transliteration: Che kār kawa, hagha ba khatā kawa
translation: He who works, makes mistakes.
meaning: Only those who try make errors — and progress.

proverb: له بارانه تېښته، تر سیلابه ورسېده
transliteration: La bārānah tēshtah, tar selābah warasēdah
translation: Escaping rain, he reached the flood.
meaning: Sometimes you escape one danger only to face a worse one.

proverb: سترګې چې ونه وینې، زړه به هېر کړي
transliteration: Stargē che na winē, zra ba her kri
translation: What the eyes don't see, the heart forgets.
meaning: Out of sight, out of mind.

proverb: چا چې توره شلوله، هغه به يې زغم کاوه
transliteration: Chā che tora shlawla, hagha ba yey zgham kawa
translation: He who unsheathes the sword must bear its burden.
meaning: One must take responsibility for their actions.

proverb: په زخمونو ملهم لګیږي، پر ژبه نه
transliteration: Pa zakhmuno marham lagigi, par zaba na
translation: Wounds can be bandaged, but not the wounds of the tongue.
meaning: Words can hurt more deeply than wounds.

proverb: یو ځانته عقل او دویم ځان ته شپه غواړې
transliteration: Yaw zāntah aql ao dweym zāntah shpa ghwāre
translation: You want wisdom for yourself and darkness for others.
meaning: Selfish people want all the benefit and none for others.

proverb: غر که له پاسه ښکلی وي، له ښکته سخت وي
transliteration: Ghar ka la pāsa shklay we, la shkhta sakht we
translation: The mountain may look beautiful from above but hard from below.
meaning: Appearances can be deceiving.

proverb: چې لاره نه لري، خدای ته به ژاړي
transliteration: Che lara na lari, Khudāy ta ba zharē
translation: He who has no way cries to God.
meaning: In desperation, people turn to faith.

proverb: په غوږ نه اورېدونکی ته ږغ مه کوه
transliteration: Pa ghwag na awridonki ta zgh ma kawah
translation: Don't speak to one who doesn't listen.
meaning: Don’t waste effort on those unwilling to listen.
